summary.para: Creates a font face for a single item (rather than going through the font face reference).

param.name: listIndex
param.para: Zero-based index of the font item in the set.

param.name: fontFace
param.para: The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to a newly created font face object.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.
|Return value|Description| |-|-| |DWRITE_E_REMOTEFONT|The font is not local.|

summary.para: Creates the font resource of a single item.

param.name: listIndex
param.para: Zero-based index of the font item in the set.

param.name: fontResource
param.para: The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to a newly created font resource object.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.
|Return value|Description| |-|-| |DWRITE_E_REMOTEFONT|The file is not local.|

summary.para: Retrieves all the item indices, filtered by the given ranges.

param.name: fontAxisRanges
param.para: List of axis value ranges to filter by.

param.name: fontAxisRangeCount
param.para: The number of axis value ranges to filter.

param.name: selectAnyRange
param.para: true if GetFilteredFontIndices should select any range; false if it should select the intersection of them all.

param.name: indices
param.para: An ascending array of indices, in the range 0 to minus 1.

param.name: actualIndexCount
param.para: The actual number of indices written or needed, in the range 0 to minus 1.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.
|Return value|Description| |-|-| |E_NOT_SUFFICIENT_BUFFER|The buffer is too small, with actualIndexCount set to the needed size. The actualIndexCount will always be <= .|

summary.para: Retrieves all the item indices, filtered by the given properties.

param.name: properties
param.para: List of properties to filter by.

param.name: propertyCount
param.para: The number of properties to filter.

param.name: selectAnyProperty
param.para: true if GetFilteredFontIndices should select any property; false if it should select the intersection of them all.

param.name: indices
param.para: An ascending array of indices, in the range 0 to minus 1.

param.name: actualIndexCount
param.para: The actual number of indices written or needed, in the range 0 to minus 1.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.
|Return value|Description| |-|-| |E_NOT_SUFFICIENT_BUFFER|The buffer is too small, with actualIndexCount set to the needed size. The actualIndexCount will always be <= .|

summary.para: Retrieves a subset of fonts filtered by the given ranges, endpoint-inclusive.

param.name: fontAxisRanges
param.para: List of axis value ranges to filter by.

param.name: fontAxisRangeCount
param.para: The number of axis value ranges to filter.

param.name: selectAnyRange
param.para: true if GetFilteredFonts should select any range; false if it should select the intersection of them all.

param.name: filteredFontSet
param.para: The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to an object representing the subset of fonts that fall within the ranges, otherwise it sets the pointer to nullptr.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

remarks.para: If no fonts match the filter, then the returned subset object will be empty (calling on it returns 0), but the function does not return an error. The subset is always equal to or less than the original set.

summary.para: Retrieves a subset of fonts filtered by the given properties.

param.name: properties
param.para: List of properties to filter by.

param.name: propertyCount
param.para: The number of properties to filter.

param.name: selectAnyProperty
param.para: true if GetFilteredFontIndices should select any property; false if it should select the intersection of them all.

param.name: filteredFontSet
param.para: The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to an object representing the subset of fonts that match the properties, otherwise it sets the pointer to nullptr.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

remarks.para: If no fonts match the filter, then the returned subset object will be empty (calling on it returns 0), but the function does not return an error. The subset is always equal to or less than the original set.

summary.para: Retrieves a subset of fonts, filtered by the given indices.

param.name: indices
param.para: An array of indices to filter by, in the range 0 to minus 1.

param.name: filteredFontSet
param.para: The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to an object representing the subset of fonts indicated by the given indices, otherwise it sets the pointer to nullptr.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

remarks.para: The indices can come in any order, meaning that GetFilteredFonts can produce a new set with items removed, duplicated, or reordered from the original. If you pass zero indices, then an empty font set is returned.

summary.para: Retrieves a new font set that contains only the first occurrence of each font resource from the set.

param.name: filteredFontSet
param.para: The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to a new font set object consisting of single default instances from font resources, otherwise it sets the pointer to nullptr.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

summary.para: Retrieves the axis ranges of a single item.

param.name: listIndex
param.para: Zero-based index of the font in the set.

param.name: fontAxisRanges
param.para: List of axis value ranges to retrieve.

param.name: maxFontAxisRangeCount
param.para: The number of axis value ranges to retrieve.

param.name: actualFontAxisRangeCount
param.para: The actual number of axis ranges written or needed.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.
|Return value|Description| |-|-| |E_NOT_SUFFICIENT_BUFFER|The buffer is too small, with actualFontAxisRangeCount set to the needed size.|

summary.para: Retrieves all axis ranges in the font set; the union of all contained items.

param.name: fontAxisRanges
param.para: List of axis value ranges to retrieve.

param.name: maxFontAxisRangeCount
param.para: The number of axis value ranges to retrieve.

param.name: actualFontAxisRangeCount
param.para: The actual number of axis ranges written or needed.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.
|Return value|Description| |-|-| |E_NOT_SUFFICIENT_BUFFER|The buffer is too small, with actualFontAxisRangeCount set to the needed size.|

summary.para: Retrieves the font face reference of a single item.

param.name: listIndex
param.para: Zero-based index of the font item in the set.

param.name: fontFaceReference
param.para: The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to the font face reference.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

summary.para: Retrieves the locality of a single item.

param.name: listIndex
param.para: Zero-based index of the font item in the set.

returns.para: Type:
A value indicating the locality.

remarks.para: The locality enumeration. For fully local files, the result will always be DWRITE_LOCALITY_LOCAL. For downloadable files, the result depends on how much of the file has been downloaded.

summary.para: Retrieves a matching font set based on the requested inputs, ordered so that nearer matches are earlier.

param.name: fontProperty
param.para: Font property of interest, such as typographic family or weight/stretch/style family.

param.name: fontAxisValues
param.para: A pointer to an array containing a list of font axis values. The array should be the size (the number of elements) indicated by the fontAxisValueCount argument.

param.name: fontAxisValueCount
param.para: The number of font axis values contained in the fontAxisValues array.

param.name: matchingFonts
param.para: The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to a prioritized list of fonts that match the properties, otherwise it sets the pointer to nullptr.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

remarks.para: This method can yield distinct items that were not in the original font set, including items with simulation flags (if they would be a closer match to the request), and instances that were not named by the font author. Items from the same font resources are collapsed into one: the closest possible match.
